div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington.
Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed June 12 1893 In the U. S. Circuit Court A. Reeves Ayres Clerk By R. M. Hopkins Deputy.

I, C. D. Bowles,first being duly sworn according to law, depose and say as follows: I accuse M. L. Coovert, of Vancouver, Clarke County, State of Washington, of the crime of selling and furnishing cigarettes, contrary to the statute in such cases made and provided, committed as follows: Said M. L. Coovert is a retail tobacco dealer doing buisness in Vancouver, County of Clarke, State of Washington, and on Friday, June the 9th, 1893, at his said place of business in said city of Vancouver, the said M. L. Coovert did sell and furnish to one C. L. McDonald one package of cigarettes, more particularly described as follows:

a bundle of ten paper wrapped cigarettes marked per cigarettes' said bundle being a tinfoil and oiled paper inside wrapper with an outside paper wrapper on which is printed the statutory caution notice, number of manufacturing district and state, and to which is affixed the required U.S. Revenue stamp duly cancelled. And harm, also printed upon ot the manufacturer's name and Brand of Cigarettes.
which said package of cigarettes was and is of the calue of ten cents Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9th day of June, 1893. C. D. Bowles
